intro: Clibadium anceps, commonly known as the giant sycamore, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its spread in the wild.
